message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item that will meet your needs. I'm willing to start with a price of $18,000 for the product. What are your thoughts?
Alice, I appreciate your offer but $18,000 is significantly above my budget.  I'm willing to pay $12,500 for the product.  This is my best offer. Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

Thanks for your offer, Bob. I understand that $12,500 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer the product to you for $14,000. This is a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $14,000 is still a bit outside my budget. I'm willing to go up to $13,000. This would be a fair deal for both of us, and I'm confident you'll find it a good compromise.

I can see you're a serious buyer, Bob, and I appreciate your willingness to compromise. However, $13,000 is still a bit lower than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to meet you at $13,500. This is the lowest I can go, and I believe it's a fair price considering the value the product brings. What do you think?

Alice, I understand you're trying to get the best price, but $13,500 is still a bit more than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to pay $13,000 for the product, which is right at my limit. This would be a fair deal for both of us. What do you think?

I can see you're not willing to budge much more, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at your limit, but I need to make a bit more than $13,000 to make this deal worthwhile for me. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $13,200. This is the lowest I can go, and I hope we can finally reach an agreement.
